q: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
h:
“It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.
h:
“Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
h:
“What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?” —
George Eliot

q: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
h:
“The best way to predict the future is to create it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:
“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
h:
“Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.” —
William James

q: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
h:
“Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower. ” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: To perceive is to suffer.
h:
“To perceive is to suffer.” —
Aristotle

q: The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.
h:
“The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Cleverness is not wisdom.
h:
“Cleverness is not wisdom.” —
Euripides

q: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
h:
“No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.” —
Aristotle

q: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.
h:
“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
h:
“Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing. ” —
Herodotus

q: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.
h:
“A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.” —
Barack Obama

q: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
h:
“You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: When we have our body and mind in order, everything else will exist in the right place, in the right way.
h:
“When we have our body and mind in order, everything else will exist in the right place, in the right way.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: Good things aren't supposed to just fall into your lap.
h:
“Good things aren't supposed to just fall into your lap.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.
h:
“What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.” —
Robert Greene

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.
h:
“Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
h:
“Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.
h:
“Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.” —
Dan Millman

q: A little impatience will spoil great plans.
h:
“A little impatience will spoil great plans.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: To be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day.
h:
“To be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.
h:
“The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.” —
Criss Jami

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.
h:
“Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The ability to hold two competing thoughts in one's mind and still be able to function is the mark of a superior mind.
h:
“The ability to hold two competing thoughts in one's mind and still be able to function is the mark of a superior mind.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
h:
“I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.” —
Estee Lauder

q: You must find the place inside yourself where nothing is impossible.
h:
“You must find the place inside yourself where nothing is impossible.” —
Les Brown

q: Walk with those seeking truth... RUN FROM THOSE WHO THINK THEY'VE FOUND IT.
h:
“Walk with those seeking truth... RUN FROM THOSE WHO THINK THEY'VE FOUND IT.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Your spirit is the true shield.
h:
“Your spirit is the true shield.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: The healthiest response to life is joy.
h:
“The healthiest response to life is joy.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.
h:
“Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.” —
Doug Ivester

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
h:
“The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.” —
Walt Disney

q: Sometimes out of your biggest misery, comes your greatest gain.
h:
“Sometimes out of your biggest misery, comes your greatest gain.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Boldness makes even the smallest animal dangerous.
h:
“Boldness makes even the smallest animal dangerous.” —
Robert Greene

q: Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth.
h:
“Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
h:
“We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
h:
“If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.” —
Buddha

q: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.
h:
“Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
h:
“Why fit in when you were born to stand out?” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
h:
“Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.” —
Rumi

q: A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
h:
“A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
h:
“A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Never give way to laziness.
h:
“Never give way to laziness.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
h:
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —
Mark Twain

q: The Art of Peace begins with you.
h:
“The Art of Peace begins with you.” —
Morihei Ueshiba
